img_above_text:
He can also easily chain this into a high leap as he somersaults into a slam onto the ground requiring another fast dodge.
Any of these attacks can be chained together with rolling kicks that come in a few different ways when he's low to the ground, so you'll need to be very aware of his movements and when the best time is to press the attack, and when to back off and conserve stamina.
img_below_text:
With many of his attacks having severely short range, the Thrust Stance can be incredibly useful to retreat into a heavy attack once you have a focus point. The Pillar Stance can also be useful to gain height over many of his low kicks, but you'll need to make sure you have a lot of spare stamina to soak up his hits.
![Wukong Brook 20.jpg](https://oyster.ignimgs.com/mediawiki/apis.ign.com/black-myth-wukong/8/8d/Wukong_Brook_20.jpg)

Any of these attacks can be chained together with rolling kicks that come in a few different ways when he's low to the ground, so you'll need to be very aware of his movements and when the best time is to press the attack, and when to back off and conserve stamina."
            - Following Text: "With many of his attacks having severely short range, the Thrust Stance can be incredibly useful to retreat into a heavy attack once you have a focus point. The Pillar Stance can also be useful to gain height over many of his low kicks, but you'll need to make sure you have a lot of spare stamina to soak up his hits.

img_summary:
1. The image depicts an intense combat scene in a snowy environment from the game "Black Myth: Wukong." The character, likely Wukong, is engaged in a battle with a large, armored enemy, with visible health and stamina bars indicating the player's status.

2. The preceding and following text provide context for the combat strategies and stances that can be used during the fight. The image illustrates a moment of action, highlighting the need for quick dodges and strategic use of different stances to counter the enemy's attacks. The narrative emphasizes the importance of managing stamina and choosing the right moments to attack or retreat.
